citation.article-title: Facklamia tabacinasalis sp. nov., from powdered tobacco.

p.s: Description of Facklamia tabacinasalis sp. nov.
Facklamia tabacinasalis (ta.ba.ci.na'sa.lis. M.L. n. tabacum tobacco; L. adj. nasalis pertaining to the nose; M.L. gen. fem. adj. tabacinasalis of snuff)
The cells are Gram-positive, non-spore-forming, large cocci that occur mostly in pairs but also singly or in short-chains.
Colonies are of irregular size, reaching a maximum diameter of 0.5 mm after 48 h on blood agar incubated at 30°C.
The colonies are round, smooth and domed (raised) with a sharp border, and are non-pigmented.
The organism is facultatively anaerobic and catalase- and oxidase-negative.

Using commercial API systems, acid is not produced from D-arabitol, L-arabinose, cyclodextrin, glycogen, lactose, melibiose, mannitol, maltose, melezitose, methyl β-D-glucopyranoside, pullulan, raffinose, ribose, sorbitol, sucrose, tagatose or trehalose.
α-Galactosidase and ester lipase C8 (weak reaction) activity is detected.

Activity is not detected for the following: alkaline phosphatase, acid phosphatase, alanine-phenylalanine-proline arylamidase, arginine dihydrolase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, chymotrypsin, trypsin, cystine arylamidase, glycyltryptophan arylamidase, α-fucosidase, β-galactosidase, β-galacturonidase, β-glucosidase, β-glucuronidase, esterase C-4, pyroglutamic acid arylamidase, α-mannosidase, β-mannosidase, leucine arylamidase and urease.
The G+C content of DNA is 40 mol% (Tm).
The organism is isolated from powdered tobacco.
